column2: It has been proven by a jury in a court room after six weeks of testimony and evidence that Heard's Op Ed was just not true or based on facts. Washington Post should retract untrue statements from their publication if they are to have any credibility at all going forward.
column26: Washington Post Remove Amber Heard Op-Ed
column33: Washington Post Remove Amber Heard Op-Ed
column34:
The Washington Post has contributed to the defamation of Johnny Depp, by posting and continuing to leave up her Op-Ed titled:

“Amber Heard: I spoke up against sexual violence — and faced our culture’s wrath. That has to change.”

Demand it be removed. 

JusticeforJohnnyDepp

column2: I watched the case. It triggered me so much as a DV survivor that a woman could take the stand to feign abuse while boldly staring at her victim. That’s what my abuser did. I recognised her behaviour and felt so much empathy for Mr. Depp. That woman abused him and should’ve served time in jail for mutilating his finger. I think it’s time the Washington Post did the right thing and deleted that defamatory article written by an alleged liar and physical abuser.
